ssRjsvfmgWolrtya7Am8MQ.text: Go to Granger & Co if you want to treat someone to a classy, hip, better than average traditional breakfast. There's queueing, so you better arrive early.The Full Aussie Breakfast is not different from the English classic but done well. Funny story: When our order was taken and the waitress repeated what we had said, she read "So 3 Full English Breakfasts..." and her colleague walked past and hissed into her ear "Aussie! Full Aussie Breakfast!". It was hard not to burst out laughing. I guess this says something about the originality of the place? Anyways, it's a really cool space and the nicest breakfast spot I know in Notting Hill.

w40kDtVkRevPdFfPjB2wmg.text: Super cute place for breakfast or brunch. I just love the decor! The sweet corn frittters dish was really good but I was not too keen on the coconut bread. It was dry, dense and lacked much of a coconut flavor. Menu items are a tad pricey for what you get as welltoasted coconut breadside of baconsweet corn fritters with roast tomato, spinach & bacon

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

dL65pQ0kRO3VJU01DORlJg.text: HOW DOES THIS PLACE ONLY HAVE 3.5 STARS??? Seriously, how? I know there can be a wait sometimes, but get over it.My girlfriend and I have been a handful of times for breakfast and once for dinner now, and have nothing but praise. Everyone who works there is super friendly and attentive. The espresso drinks are fantastic, as well as the wine, and the pale ale I got was about as crisp and lovely as they come. Then there's the food! You really can't go wrong. The olives and the fish curry were two standouts, but honestly everything was great. I'd be there every day if I lived nearby!

Q4Z1RKwp5mId7xjHZ2iEgw.text: Many years ago this was the site of one of my all-time favourite restaurants, Palio. I never understood why it closed, especially as it was replaced by a never-ending succession of ill-fated ventures.At long last, a suitable replacement has taken its place. It's taken me a while to find an excuse to visit Granger & Co, and a girlie catch-up on a Monday evening seemed the perfect occasion.We both went for the catch of the day (in our case John Dory pan-fried whole) followed by the most delicious pavlova which we shared.Everythying about Granger & Co is just right: the food, the ambience, the staff, and it's well worth the price. We went before the current heatwave set in, and now it's probably even more perfect.Can't wait to find an excuse for my next visit.

_AWcM6u9V0zozEwpHmuONg.text: Feeling a little homesick these past few weeks, and I had decided to meet up with an Aussie friend for brunch on Saturday, and having eaten at Granger & Co back home in Aus, I felt this was the best opportunity to try out Granger & Co here in the UK. I arrived around 11am, and there was a short line, which was moving quite quickly. We ended up being seated not long after 11:15am. I had checked out the menu earlier in the week, and had finally decided on what I was going to order. Mind you, I will have to go back a few times to really try everything I want to. I settled on rice porridge with coconut yoghurt and mango, with an americano, and my friend on the full Aussie breakfast, complete with tomato sauce, and tea. The service was attentive, and there seemed to be plenty of wait staff. Our meal came out quite quickly. However the coffee's came out ever so slowly.My porridge was amazing! It was soo delicious. And the Aussie breakfast looked unreal, the eggs were so creamy!I had ordered a second coffee, which was forgotten, until I asked a second time. Which was a bit of a shame. But overall the experience was enjoyable, and felt like I was home. Perfect experience for the homesickness in me.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Rice porridge, yogurt and mango. Soo tasty!!!

TLvBg6cqdiUuOz7rLvtqyQ.text: This was quite a busy breakfast spot! Great coffee and the breakfast was full of flavour at a good price! Their scrambled eggs are quite unique! This is a very open and inviting atmosphere.Will be back!

ngSaWHaewcd95o9Wy35how.text: Service was good and the food was to die for. My friends and I went for lunch, so I ordered the Kim chi fried rice with the soft shell crab. I'm always a bit sceptical when a non-Asian restaurant has Asian items on their menu, but I was blown away by the flavours and the presentation of the dish. I also had a watermelon frappe, which didn't disappoint. This is my go-to brunch place in this neighbourhood!

joRuPxNwS2_zc_la54xy2w.text: Great place for breakfast or lunch. I had the ricotta hotcakes and my husband had the tuna burger.  Both were delicious!

TIsChAXgKYQqXiI0-h4pMg.text: Beautiful restaurant with a buzzing atmosphere and delicious brunch fare. They have loads of healthy options which is sometimes rare on brunch menus. This location is typically busy on the weekends and you may have to line up outside  to get a table. If you are in a small party I highly suggest going for the first come first serve bar seating where you can have an equally pleasant dining experience. I highly recommend the Fresh Aussie, which comes with smoked salmon, poached egg, avocado, sautéed greens and cherry tomatoes. All of the ingredients are deliciously fresh and flavorful and they poach their eggs perfectly! They also have very nice iced coffee and juice. Granger and Co is the perfect escape from the hectic crowds of Portobello Road.

sw2K3b451-OloQf7Z8vpGA.text: I would definitely recommend the brunch here.  Everyone in our party loved their brunch.   I got the most "unusual" brunch item out of the group: the Asian inspired chicken soup.   I wasn't feeling so well, so I decided in the soup and I was so glad.   Not sure why if we were especially hungry from our travels or what, but we did buy 2-3 extra sides of toast and the toast is surprisingly delicious.   Often toast is just "throw away" but not here.   Super long wait filled with people who spent a lot of time getting ready for brunch.  Delighted that the food and drink lived up to the hype.

1GRgWsSrHkFiD5KETX43gg.text: I came at lunch time. Very crowded, very busy. I had a yellow fish plate. It was just fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Yellow fish carry

1OzbIDDj8jtfhD--snXRPg.text: Absolutely loved our brunch experience here. We were visiting from New York and stumbled upon Granger & Co before exploring Portobello Road on a Saturday morning. We had to wait about 20-30 minutes for our table, but were able to get some coffee during our wait. The place itself has a great vibe and the food was delicious. Have recommended to all of my friends visiting London, and we will definitely be back ourselves on the next trip! Cheers!

14Wzf5DlzoLQVtJK0kMOww.text: Posh crowd. I once saw an orange Ferrari parked directly in front of the restaurant. Plan to arrive before 9:30 if you only want to queue for 5-10 minutes. They dont take reservations but they will seat you if you arrive before the rest of your party. I had to try the ricotta banana hotcakes with honeycomb butter because almost every review boasts about how amazing they are.  You get 3 large puffy hotcakes stacked over half a slice of banana.  my initial reaction after my first bite was that it tasted and had the texture of raw pancake batter. But as I continued to nosh I began to understand what makes this dish so popular. The texture is due to the ricotta cheese and whipped egg souffle-like batter.  The hotcakes are extremely fluffy and moist.  They almost float. What surprised me was that it wasn't as sweet as I imagined it to be (which is good!). The dish is accompanied by a very light maple syrup which doesn't overwhelm and allows you to appreciate the creamy ricotta cheese hotcake.  This is the most interesting item to order from their breakfast menu. My husband ordered the chili fried egg bacon sandwich on brioche. I could not taste the chili but the brioche bun was very fresh.Definitely a nice place to go for any meal if you want to be in a buzzing dining room filled with posh patrons. Note: there has always been at least one baby screeching each time I've been here.This restaurant is exactly what one would expect it to be like.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Honeycomb ricotta hotcakes
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Chili fried egg with bacon on brioche
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Latte

UdHlFnr-ExyA3GqdHbjzWA.text: I've eaten twice here while I was in London & I think this restaurant is my favorite.  The ambiance of this place is so cute!  During my two visits with some friends, we were able to try:Fresh Aussie: The tea smoked salmon was delish, and the poached eggs were perfect with the avocado! Loved this dish!Full Aussie: Scrambled eggs were heaven!Coconut bread: Really yummy, the coconut flavor wasn't too overpowering. This would probably be perfect with some tea :) Chia Seed Pot: It reminded me of a coconut tapioca pudding. Its really good and something light.  It could even be a dessert after breakfast in my opinion.Latte: I think that it's interesting that they serve their lattes in a glass cup instead of a regular coffee cup.  but nonetheless, it was still good. If I could eat here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, I would. lol. Granger & Co. is always a good idea. :)

5voa8b8PWYhG6w2Bob9IAA.text: The ricotta pancakes. OMG. We had to wait about 45-50 minutes because it was mid-afternoon on a Sunday. It was so worth it! The service was great and the hostess was so considerate in seating everyone as efficiently as possible. Props to her for dealing with some pretty high maintenance customers that day as well. I had the scrambled eggs on the side which were heavenly also. An awesome atmosphere, followed by an adorable walk around portobello. Is it weird how happy I was to find Aesop soap and hand balm in the toilets? This was the best brunch I've had in London for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

3P985exFkgunpuqaKTqe8A.text: Awesome pancakes! The kids and I loved the pancakes with ricotta and bananas!! Light , fluffy and so good! It was our first time there and we will definitely return before we head back to California !!! The service was good too. The location is perfect. Loved the neighborhood!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Yummy cappuccino
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Best pancakes!

ksewDf5Hw9YodfNxIzp81g.text: Love this place. Best whipped eggs I've ever had. There is generally a long line for Sunday Brunch, but it is definitely worth the wait! Whenever I fly into London this place is on my brunch list.

7Eo4E6ggP2FfNFqhwcpJMw.text: I have been a server for 10 years and have never experienced anything like this. This place had great reviews so we chose to have breakfast here. The server came and took our order after 15 minutes and then 45 minutes later, no drinks, no food, no server. After an hour I stopped the manger and ask him what was going on and he waved me off and walked away. Because I was a server I sat there for an hour and 15 mins because I was trying to give them the benefit of the doubt. It was the worst experience I have ever had. My husband and I were only in London for 24 hours and all I wanted to do is have brunch in Notting Hill, what a big fat bummer. Nevertheless, we walked out and went down the street to 202 restaurant and received great service and amazing food!

i9agrNmUaX4AH5lbTkvslA.text: Great ResturantOn Business in London from Hong Kong and came here for dinner Originally from Sydney so know the Bills model wellThe Notting Hill Resturant is super with the Duck the standout dish and the Allpress coffee to finish one of the best coffees in London

pcMkh23FC6KgWWCZAIHW6w.text: Visiting London from US for a few days. This place was walking distance from my hotel. Got there a little after 8AM on a Sat and already they were doing a brisk business. In the hour I was there a line formed.Was dining solo so was sat at the bar. Service was friendly and attentive.Coffee (latte) was excellent. While I wasn't really into a sweet breakfast, had read the reviews of their hotcakes. They didn't disappoint. I could smell the cooked egg as the plate was placed before me. The hotcakes are really puffy and airy not the flat pancakes you'd expect. You don't get that volume unless you whip the egg whites separately. Sure enough saw a some unincorporated egg whites (cooked obviously just wasn't fully incorporated into the batter - no big deal). Some ricotta sprinkled in each hotcake. Didn't really get much added flavor from the ricotta. Really it was all about the light fluffy texture of the hotcakes. Wish I could go back to try more off their menu.

98NB3qTZ_VrivGckhuVjbg.text: Great service. Cozy, warm, and elegant place to begin your morning with on a winter day. Most impressed with the flavor of their syrup used for the hotcakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Hot cakes and eggs are not bad. The syrup was dope tho.. Wish I can bring a jar back

0hFGS-mp7HE6gO2l4dkJSg.text: This was a fun place to have breakfast. If there is a wait, don't let it detour you, it's worth it. I really liked the scramble eggs and coconut bread. The coffee was strong for me, but the lattes were delicious .  Walking distance from Portobello Rd.

jdh0Lz8lygJFyOPak5yJWg.text: This place has been on my brunch wish list for SO long and finally a few weekends ago we plucked up the courage for the queue (pick a warm, dry day) and headed to Westbourne Grove. We joined it just before 10.30 and were seated by 11am  - not bad. They seem to have a pretty slick operation but it does make it a bit stressful, being constantly hounded about timings. We were offered 2 seats at the bar so parked up and took the menu (for no reason as I have been studying it for over a year and know it off by heart!). I reallllly couldn't decide what to have but in the end went for the ricotta hotcakes with banana as they sounded so different. My bf went for scrambled eggs on toast and asked for the side of bacon, mushrooms and sausage for £4 to be told it was £4 for ONE of them (yikes at the cost and the lack of clarity!). We both ordered a coffee and a juice. The coffee came quickly but the juice took a further 10 minutes while people who had arrived after us had theirs. The food also took quite a while to come and when it did I was not wowed by the portion size or the presentation. Yes, pancakes are just round and brown but they could have made it look a little pretty with the banana. Instead raw banana was just sliced in two and hidden beneath them (why couldnt they caramelise them and present them nicely?) We were starving so tucked in. The scrambled eggs LOOK amazing but have very little seasoning, the bacon was amazing and the toast was good. My ricotta hotcakes were OK but I didn't think the ricotta added anything to it and I have had fluffier nicer pancakes else where. Overall a huge disappointment and really expensive for what it was - GUTTED (did I mention the OJ was £5 for the smallest glass?). There are still things on the menu I want to try so proooobably will be back but I wish they took bookings/ served breakfast past 12pm on weekends!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Coconut bread
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

xlqSqQq6dc0BWyZeyq0LiQ.text: We were recommended this restaurant from an American student friend of ours who had just spent four years at an art school here in London. This young lady has impeccable taste so we were not surprised when our lunch here at Granger & Co. turned out to be very, very good.This trendy restaurant located in the heart of the Notting Hill section of London has an upscale clientele and the food is upscale to please their customers.Healthy, clean, lean, organic food that is prepared with great care and finesse. Not only does this food taste good, it looks good as well.We had a Shrimp Burger with fries, Chicken Wiener Schnitzel, a Grain Salad and Chicken meatballs and pasta. Everyone at my table was extremely happy with their choices. They are not stingy either. The portions were ample enough to carry us all through to a late dinner reservation tonight.This was one of our better lunches here in London. We are going to come back this weekend for breakfast an see how they pull this meal off. My money is on them!

KCxa8JIvyp5tyzIOusQgvw.text: Went there for a Saturday brunch around 12. I was lucky my friends had done the 30' line for me. The service was really nice. We shared the squid appetiser ! It was so good We all took one of bills specials scrambled eggs or poached eggs with some basic brunch sides. I tasted good. However I think it's pricy for what it is (I needed to add two sides to my scrambled eggs: smoked salmon and avocado). While you would expect that one of these could be included in an egg dish. Overall the service was nice it's comfy and the food quality is good! But need one queue for 40minutes in average to get in ?! Not sure ... Also we had the hotcakes for desert that we shared among three and it was enough !

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Generous plate of the special scrambled eggs. Beware tea smoked salmon is cooked salmon.

xVTA8hSdLvT1l86inogCdA.text: Lovely and lively neighborhood spot featuring fresh and delightful ingredients. Love their smoked salmon!! And the avocado on toast with a poached egg is perfectly done on thick cut rye toast and fresh cilantro. I always order the fresh juices. Occasionally I splurge on the Aussie's breakfast plate but only when I am really hungry!

5IAkCUhdouzfjSTbxjirSA.text: There is nothing better in the Notting Hill Area. Amazing food, unbelievable atmosphere...what more can you ask for!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

MS6dXF6gYgSaw4hp9GIoEg.text: Amazing. Bill Granger, you've done it again. I was searching for the best pancakes and Granger & Co certainly delivered. And the coffee - yes! Coffee snob satisfied. It's a bit pricey but worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta hot cakes - yes!
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. COFFEE

OJYIHUGDfpoLBgoXglvNWA.text: So, so good. Plan to lineup if you are coming in the morning. I like the lineup. Ask for a take away coffee whilst you wait. They know how to coffee. They are also able to do you a takeaway juice if that's your thing. If you're a solo diner, there is usually a spot at the bar so it will be faster for you to get a place. Good spot to eat on your own... Great people watching. Lots of attractive people eat here...Once you're in, if it's brunch you're in for, then your biggest problem now is committing to something. Everything is great. They have some fresher, healthier options like the fresh aussie, very delicious scrambled eggs and a full Aussie (like a full english but Aussie), ricotta hot cakes or, my favourite, the baked spinach and eggs - get with a side of bacon or av salsa. All the sides are super yummy.If you're there for lunch they have the most amazing salmon and soba noodle dish as well as a raw tuna salad. It's a great place to eat a very nutritious, healthy lunch and still feel completely satisfied. Don't worry, there is also a burger. So much veggie, so much green, so much favour. I don't think you can go wrong.The drinks list is excellent. A slight Australian skew (to be expected) but all in all a complete list of great options. Definitely try a coopers pale if you are feeling like a beer (it's what the South Aussies drink). The juices are also good- I love the green one! Last, but certainly not least, the cakes and muffins are some of the best I have ever seen. It's a very dangerous spot to sit at the bar and stare at those beautiful baked goods. Soooo so tempting. They do take away too.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Broken eggs with spinach ricotta and pinenuts
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Scone with a dash of passion fruit- not too sweet
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. The fresh Aussie

B_neMOvwt8FqRXguyDE85Q.text: Great food, service is passable. Expect a wait. Have fun. Jasmine smoked salmon is a must try. Enjoy my fellow humanoids.

1S8cSoBIiJ897xYHoSvJxw.text: The hype for Granger & co. is through the roof, the ricotta hotcakes this, the eggs that........The queue of people had obviously been reading the same reviews as me. I don't do queuing but I really wanted to try this place, so we queued. From the very beginning, there was something very off about the guy that served us, he took our order but had to ask us to repeat because, not once did he look at us, his eyes went to the door, the kitchen, the bar, passing folk but never us. I said to my friend, "I bet he gets the order wrong". I love being right.When the order came, my dish was wrong, another waiter bought the food to us-which took ages btw and he was very sweet and polite. The original waiter came back and very aggressively almost accused me of ordering the wrongly delivered dish. No apology for his mistake.When the food did arrive, it was admittedly delicious, even with the bitter taste left by the waiter. I had halloumi with egg, hummus, bacon and I love people which uses parsley in a bold fashion. The miso mushrooms were bland though. I also had a hot chocolate which took a good 15 minutes to arrive and was chocolate sauce on the inside of a teeny glass and then filled with hot milk. Not a hot chocolate, nor cool, nor fulfilling the desired promise. Sigh.We ordered the ricotta hotcakes as per hype. But it was terrible, lumpy, bland, boring, weird, yuck.Bill time came and, you guessed it, Mr Charm left the wrong item on the bill....I questioned this and he bought it back over with no apology and the item removed without subbing in the correct item. Now folks, I would usually say something but as this guy was such an ass, I didn't bother. He turned his back on us as we left so justified decision.Overall, its expensive, not worth the hype although it's ego and hipsters will keep it afloat but in any case, my time was ruined. ZERO stars. Never again.

JhFN8jD0PC1RnwO-GRX56Q.text: Known for a being a great breakfast/bunch posh spot, we decided to try it for dinner.  Of course it was busy, service wasn't exactly friendly despite previous reviews, but the decor and space is clean and modern - a nice place to hang out. On first look at the menu it didn't seem all that exciting.  Yes it's an eclectic mix of Asian, middle eastern and European flavours as the magpie food of modern Australia is, but in all honesty it looked like a random collection of foods with no overarching story. I was pleasantly surprised by my first small plate of miso aubergine, it was small, but brilliantly balanced creating strong umami topped off with little crispy cubes of silken tofu delicately fried to perfection.  The creamy burrata was great, but in all honesty when is burrata not good and if you can't place a piece of burrata on a plate with some tomatoes then shame on you. Deep fried squid was a tiny plate again but the tempura was excellent, light and crispy though the sweet chilli dipping sauce was a bit generic.  Korean barbeque chicken was dry and overcooked, both the meat and skin suffered, I would have preferred eating some hot wings from KFC and the gochujang based sauce was poorly balanced. Parmesan crusted chicken schnitzel was so-so, a nice fennel salad went with this, but the coating just went soft and soggy in less than a minute, the chicken meat itself was pretty average. This seems like a plate that hasn't been mastered yet, but is placed on the menu to satisfy the hordes of chicken lovers and for those who want something more European.So, I can see why it's a popular place, a really nice space, with modern food and there were some good plates, but also some really average plates. And at £90 for two people you can eat much better food.  Style over substance is a bit harsh, but there is a certain group of people who will love this place and another who will wonder what all the fuss is about.  If you're into the posh west London thing, this is the price you pay. Perhaps a few little tweaks to the foox will make it deserving of it's price tag, but clearly Granger and Co is popular and it's not just about the food.  I mean who serves labneh without bread??? How do you eat it? But I guess there is probably a high number of people with gluten allergies in this part of London.

ZOlQqCpdXfDYrqHtoUFNXw.text: I went to G&Co thanks to a friend.  I went there as an Aussie Pub.  What I found was a laid back, great place with great food.  One of the wait staff had serious attitude but rest was just perfect.I had a shrimp burger and it was delicious.  It had a nice tangy sauce on it and I couldn't eat slow!  My friend had a miso salmon.  I usually don't like salmon but this one was seriously succulent.  As appetizer we just had burrata.  They gave it with very thin toasted bread and some tomato on top.  I never had such a delightful piece of bread.Most of the wait staff was courteous and nice in general.  But one was not really nice.  He bumped into my friends chair and instead of apologizing he was looking for an apology.  If not for him, it'd have been 5 stars easily.

aB-pR1Bawb8uN_0cCc6tiA.text: After 40 minutes queuing (mind you, it was saturday lunch time) with a lot of french people (?) we were finally seated. It's a good looking room (pleasant decor, nothing fancy) filled with young good looking people there to be seen in a hip place and enjoy the ambience + soundtrack of moneyed youth's chit chat. It's said to be a favourite amongst Notting Hill yummy mummies, but luckily for us there was not a single crying baby to be heard.We decided to check out the hype and ordered the famous ricotta hotcakes with bananas. They are indeed very fluffy and light, if a bit bland if you prefer stronger flavours; I enjoyed mine. The honeycomb butter is simply delicious and I wish there were more of it. The syrup was quite nice too, not overly sweet but adding some welcome extra sweetness to the cakes. They'll give you three huge cakes and they're quite filling; I am happy I skipped the side dishes as I would be able to finish. I really wanted to sample the beautiful looking cakes, but simply coudn't eat another thing.What I regreted was the hot chocolate: basically they rub a bit of melted choc inside a glass and fill it with hot milk; not a bad idea and it does look nice, but it tastes of warm water with a touch of bitterness. Awful. In fact I would have ordered a latte, but I couldn't find it on the menu... Even though later I did see lattes/cappuccinos on tables, I guess you have to ask? Odd. All in all is a pleasant place with alright food and beautiful clientele to look at. I wouldn't go out of my way for the food alone, and maybe in a few months when the hype dies down a little and I don't have to queue I'll return for that cake I couldn't manage.

7epWdtybUrIFOys6TcAzbw.text: Go for the ricotta hotcakes alone! It is one of my favorite brunch places in Notting Hill. Sure, there is a line sometimes. Try the weekdays for quicker breakfast service.  It's an adorable, modern chic restaurant. Staff are super friendly and accomodating. I haven't tried anything besides breakfast, so I can't review.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta Hotcakes

cM54DkQvBlqzUXAVBTW5HQ.text: This place does not take reservations, you should come and wait in a queue. It took us about half an hour to get seated. The breakfast was worth the wait , they really have the best scrambled eggs in the world. After that we had the ricotta hot cakes, delicious and soft. Overall, this place deserves all the fuss!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Amazing breakfast  so delicious

gDH5nirgeHhe35TMTP3hxA.text: Came here for breakfast and was not disappointed! There's always a queue at this place for breakfast/brunch, so try to go early (by 9-10 am). The space is beautiful, coffee is good, food is yummy, service was a bit inattentive/slow though. Got the ricotta hot cakes (YUMM), which is moist and somehow dense and fluffy at the same time - great texture that adds a twist on the traditional pancake.

SKlkDuKBB_LcwQ3aHDfAvw.text: I went to Granger&Co to try the Ricotta pancakes I had heard so much about and was really looking forward to it. I was on my own and sat at the bar so I didn't need to wait and got inside right away which was nice.The place was full and really busy so the waiters were running all around. All the staff was super nice and my order was taken quickly. It took quite a while for the food to come out though but I finally received my plate of nice looking pancakes. 3 pancakes stacked on top of two half of a banana and a jug of maple syrup on the side.However the pancakes were barely warm and two out of three were quite dry and barely had any ricotta in them. The third one had much more ricotta and was much better though still pretty cold. I didn't want to wait any longer for another plate and the staff was so busy so I didn't dare to send them back. I think I was just unlucky and that these can be very nice pancakes indeed, but at this price, they should come out perfect everytime.

KcLYkwrti0KO5XwBBgCD5g.text: I had the ricotta pancakes here and they were pretty delicious but I am giving the place three stars for two reasons: 1. The 1.5 hour wait in the cold to get in.  If you don't mind waiting, go here. If you do, definitely don't go here on a Saturday/Sunday morning. 2. I got the green juice and had really high hopes for it, but it was slightly a disappointment and was far too gingery :(

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta pancakes and green smoothie

w_IDOpd1zkLZhO99LHoP-g.text: Really delicious latte and the brioche toast with labneh, raspberry vanilla jam + chopped pistachios is heavenly!!! I got the fresh "squeezed" almond milk as well and only spent £12. Really bright atmosphere. Highly recommend this brunch spot

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Labneh, raspberry vanilla jam + pistachio brioche toast. Caffe latte. Almond milk

Da95YmCRu8M0jQqCcvhH1g.text: Went here for dinner and we ordered some spiced cashews, ginger and crab fried rice, and a hamburger with gruyere. The spiced cashews were okay, but they tasted a bit like candied nuts that you got for christmas last year and forgot about in your spice cupboard (that smells slightly of cumin. ). After eating a few, they somehow grow on you.I enjoyed my crab and ginger fried rice. Very fragrant and a really large portion. However it came with a strange side dish of egg noodles and chilli sauce, and the noodles tasted a tad stale. Burger was nothing to write home about and the side of fries tasted a bit strange- not sure if it was the oil used or the seasoning on them.  So overall, the food is ok.Now, the decor and service. We sat near the front, which was really squishy, beside some fire extinguishers and a very precarious light on a cable.  Wait staff did exactly that- made us wait a really long time for everything, and not particularly responsive.Overall, what would have been an ok, 3 star meal was rendered subpar based on the staff and ambience. I will not return unless an emergency.

lu2m-bk_Pzor-y4OwFm1ng.text: Great scene, excellent full Aussie breakfast (the mushrooms and tomatoes were some of the best I've had, but the scrambled eggs were very bland - the polar opposite to Granger's original restaurant in Sydney), but ridiculously expensive for what it is.  Added 1/2 a star because they could substitue GF bread for regular.

tSvbc3y5CdVhuEhtzXFRTA.text: Wonderful food and service. Had the most delicious jam on my toast. Great fresh juice as well. Adorable cafe setting with great ambiance for breakfast or lunch.

UKgZDWZc3ECrjC4cWeZY-g.text: My girlfriend and I were vacationing in London for a few days between Christmas and NYE. We were staying near Hyde Park and had passed this place a few times while exploring the neighborhood on foot. From the outside, it appeared modern, inviting, crowded (always a good sign) and new. In fact it was so new that when we tried searching for reviews online, none had been written yet. Our final evening in town, we decided to give it a shot for a late dinner. I ordered the burger. Safe choice it seemed, but man was I wrong. About halfway into it, I bit into something hard. My girlfriend thought I was just being a wuss. "It's just a little gristle, can't hurt you." I knew it wasn't. I spit out the bite into my napkin and dug through my chewed food to find a piece of glass ... followed by a second piece of glass. I had bitten right through it. The two pieces together were about the size of a dime.I don't even remember what my girlfriend ordered, nor does it matter, because there was GLASS IN MY BURGER.The waiter was nice, but seemed young and inexperienced and therefore completely terrified when we explained to him what had happened. Enter the manager. Her genuine concern was peppered with a hint of skepticism ("Hmm...we don't even allow glass in our kitchen ... I don't know how this could have happened!"). Granted London is an expensive city, but I'm not in the habit of carrying around shards of glass in my pocket to scam free meals on vacation. She offered to remake my burger but, needless to say, we had both lost our appetites. In the end, our meal was comped but not our wine. I suppose I would have needed to be gushing blood from my mouth to be comped the entire bill. Perhaps UK society just isn't as litigious as ours here in the States?I sincerely hope they solved the mystery of the origins of the glass. Had we not been one of the last tables of the night, and instead were drawing the attention of a full restaurant, I suspect the incident would have had a severe impact on the early success of this newbie on the block.

DICFU2stnCj-2y2P_b9TMg.text: My never-ending quest for a good brunch in my local area too me to Bill Granger's new venture. Twice.  The first time we got there at midday and were told that it would be an hour's wait.  Yeah, well, screw that!Happened to wake up early this past Sat (new year's resolution still hanging on by a thread!) so made it to Granger & co by 9.30. It was full!  We managed to nab the last free table. The service was a little pushy when it came to taking orders -- I felt as if they wanted us fed and out ASAP.  That was, until we had to ask twice for the bill (no pun intended). So, actually, service is just a little scrappy. The servers are rushed off their feet, though.I ordered corn fitters with bacon and a side of avocado salsa; my boyfriend ordered the full Aussie with a sided of sliced avocado; our friend ordered the ricotta hot cakes.  Good things: corn fritters were tasty and generously 'corny', my boyfriends breakfast was good save the scrambled eggs, our friend's hoecakes were light ands fluffyBad things: measly one thin rasher of pale bacon with my corn fritters (I loathe un-crispy bacon), boyfriend's scrambled eggs were bland, everything too greasy.Cakes perch prettily on the bar counter.  We asked what flavours they were; waiter didn't know.  We settled on carrot.  Again, greasy, greasy.  Coffee-flavoured icing on carrot cake also just does not work.  What's wrong with a good ol' vanilla cream cheese frosting?I'd go back just because it's a bright, cheery space, it's convenient and it s nicer than 202 down the road.  Tom's (also down the road) is better for brunch but tiny so unless you get there super early be prepared to wait.  Mind you, the wait is horrible for Granger's as well...So my quest continues...*sigh*

dt4kKU-As7RO9574UF0Ddw.text: Aussie coffee, best scrambled eggs in London, fresh and seasonal dishes that are always delicious... Can't go wrong. Expect to wait on weekends for brunch, but I just use this time to enjoy my first flat white of the day. And the staff are always lovely!

O8TibErSW_lVHajrI6KqEA.text: I came here after a long flight to London from San Francisco.  What a great first spot to have your first meal.  Can't recommend the watermelon and pork belly salad enough.  The waitresses are cute as well.

hG-2td1VAmGvhIkPyk8JYQ.text: Came here on a early September Friday morning, wanted to see what the fuss was about. Always drove past and no matter what time it was a cue was happening. So here we are trying out the food. The atmosphere was amazing buzzy. Unfortunately my girlfriend had to rush to a work meeting so we were not able to stay for long but what I ordered the  toasted rye and avocado with lime was really good, fresh. My coffee was excellent as well. Staff are friendly and efficient. Loved one of the waiters he had a sense of hummer and you could see they worked non stop. Its great when you go to places and the staff actually love their job. My girlfriend and I both enjoyed it but it was very quick experience must go back to enjoy it more.

1IYM6nNkDpnvL58IW07BVg.text: This review is for brunch.I would have given this place 3 stars based only on the food.  However, the ABYSMAL service (and I mean ABYSMAL by London, and even tempted to say Parisian standards) inspired me to downgrade it to 1 star.  I won't go into the food much, but I will note that the menu is decent, the quality of food is on par with places like Lantana (coffee is not as good though), and the portions are generous.  Aside from that, the terrible service alone was enough to discourage me from ever returning again.Why was the service at Granger & Co crap?  1.  We arrived at 11 am on Sunday and queued for something like 45 minutes.  This would not have been a huge problem if the restaurant was actually busy.  However, they had more than enough waiters, and we saw tons of empty tables inside.  I have never been to a restaurant that was so bad at seating people.  There were at least 6 parties waiting outside, and 3 empty tables at one time inside.  It took around 10-15 minutes before an empty table was reseated with a new party. This was pretty much the pattern throughout the whole 2-3 hours we were there.  Note to the hostess: People hate waiting outside, especially when it's freezing cold, so you might want to hurry the f--- up.2.  Reason #2 was the tipping point for me.  Around the 40 minute mark in our queue time, we saw the staff finally starting to bring in the next lot to fill the 3 empty tables.  We counted and saw that we would be able to take the last available table.  However, there was a group of first class a-holes (originally behind us in line) who were now trying to negotiate their way to the table that was meant for us.  We thought there would be no way the hostess would allow them to take our table when we and several others had been waiting out in the freezing cold for almost an hour.  Oops, we were wrong.  That stupid hostess decided it would be okay to seat them, even though they had originally accepted seats at the bar.  Later, I realised that this was probably because they knew someone who worked at the restaurant.  These people looked like total wankers (single people around late 20s/early 30s, bleached blond hair, tons of shopping bags, wearing designer clothes and sunglasses on a CLOUDY DAY), and they actually waved at the queue outside smugly to demonstrate how they were cool enough to get a table before everyone else.  Yes, you are so cool to allow the families with  babies and toddlers to freeze outside for that much longer so that you can take a table.  Shame on you people, seriously shame on you.  And shame on the hostess for actually yielding to these jerks.Everyone in the queue saw what happened, and there was an uproar.  By this time, we were seriously pissed off, so some of us went into the restaurant to yell at the hostess.  She seemed surprised that we were so upset, but our bitching worked, and we eventually were able to push that cheeky party of 3 to a small table and reclaim the table for 4 that was meant for us.  They looked really upset that they had to share a table for two---that's what you get for thinking you can actually get away with being first class jerks at a brunch place.  You might get away with that kind of behaviour at a club/bar meant for turkeys, but you need a serious reality check if you think you can get away with it anywhere else.  Ahhh victory is sweet.  3.  The waiter got our orders wrong.4.  It took around 20 minutes from the time we got our bill to the time the waiter actually came around with the card machine.  Note to the owner: When people are actually willing to pay and leave, you should probably hurry up so that you can seat a new party.  It would be smarter from a business perspective to allow seated people to wait a little longer for their orders so that other people can leave and new parties can be seated.  You need to read up on restaurants as a business model.  My overall recommendation to the owner: Fire your hostess, she sucks at her job.  In this economy, you can surely find someone better.  And try to manage your waiters & the wait system better.  My recommendation to brunch- goers:  Go somewhere else.

9-79ZFIFkqAEdRHflmxJpw.text: I have been here for brunch as well as dinner and enjoyed my meal both times.  I asked for my salmon to be rare and it actually came out rare!  When they list to my request it's a shoe-in for another visit.

Ras6Q78E5lsfkci-Whlz6A.text: Delicious Australian restaurant, just opened in November 2011, long queues over the weekend that seem justified. Finally a great brunch place in Notting Hill? In spite of the wonderful weekend appeal of Notting Hill, the choice for brunch places is quite limited: Toms is charming but very small with a fresh but unsurprsing menu, 202 is too posh (for me at least) and with a limited choice, The Electric is great but sooo dark, The Tabernacle is great during the summer and with kids but the food is nothing special, etc. Here comes Granger & Co and we were sold on our first visit (in spite of the queues). Compared to other reviewer on Qype I had a fantastic experience but cant compare it to other Granger places as I had never heard of the chef, a kind of Aussie version of Jamie Oliver (or maybe Jamie Oliver is in fact a Brit version of Bill Granger after all). So we liked the bright, light and airy dining room, and the casual all day menu available. All the food we had Aussie breakfast, eggs, hamburger, fritters and pasta) were excellent and still different from our usual family brunches. Maybe it was the Australian feel in fact. The staff was very friendly and our waiter took great care of us, even getting some special pasta made for one of our children who didnt like the sauce on the menu (and only charged £4 for the pasta). So we will be back, the only issue is that the price to pay is a long queue before lunch, not the best way to spend part of Saturday or Sunday but once inside the restaurant it feels well worth it, tasty, friendly, well-designed and good value for money (£55 for 4 brunch, 2 adults and 2 children). A new favourite!

Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom

LR5cv78gjTXlxNuQVOQRPQ.text: Currently one of London's hottest Sunday breakfast/brunch venues with queue a dozen long. Australia Chef - Bill Granger knows how to present a great restaurant with a great atmosphere and fresh modern food. Front of house manager is exceptionally good. Efficient and friendly and ensures no queue jumping.Full of locals enjoying their weekend.To order - great coffee, the hot cakes or corn fritters.

zu5Gtz4hiU2Nl45uwQVnxw.text: cool brunch spot serving up yum ricotta hotcakes, a belly-full aussie bfast and potent iced coffee perfect for that rare english day that singes. minus a star cuz waiter was bit of a dimwit.

xCk_XYjd86ClX__gZ5mO8Q.text: So... I've been waiting to eat at a Bill Granger restaurant ever since he opened bills in sydney - I even considered going there, just to check it out, but it is rather a long way to go for brunch... anyway now that there's one slightly nearer to hand, I managed to fix with friends to go there for brunch - and was very keen to try the signature ricotta hotcakes with banana and honeycomb butter. So first of all, we arrived at 10am on a Sunday and had to wait at lest 50 minutes for a table. Strangely enough when we were eventually seated, there were 3 emoty tables, which seemed a bit odd. Anyway, onto the actual food. The standout dish? The warm banana chocolate chip bread with riicotta which my friends ordered to start. I only had a corner as I wanted to save room for the hotcakes, but it was delicious, melting chocolate, slightly salty ricotta cutting through it...yum. The hotcakes? Well they were OK, light and fluffy, but would have been SO much better if the banana had been grilled with some of that honeycomb butter. Raw banana? Not so much. In fact I left the banana and butter and just had the pancakes on their own with maple syrup. One of my friends ordered the corn fritters, which were good, very fresh, crunchy corn and a decent amount of bacon and tomato salsa. I was happy to see they serve Allpress espresso coffee, my favourite kind. I would go back, but on a weekday when the lines aren't so long, and I'd have that banana bread again.

BT_bvdzfDjxqMLh6uWzBtQ.text: Wait staff are very annoying and slow but the food is good (and just a tad bit over priced). Lack of decent brunch places in the area contribute to the line and I would only drop by if you're not fussed about waiting. Not the place to go if crowds or bad service irritate you.

xBsNQmU8QS0cwQUIG8_53Q.text: we had breakfast here and ordered the full aussie breakfast and the cornfritters. both dishes were very good. i particularly enjoyed the scrambled eggs. you would think scrambled eggs are just scrambled eggs, but these were cooked to perfection. they were smooth, fluffy and had a slight creamy texture. it is always a long wait on weekends, so arrive early or expect a long wait. we're looking forward to coming here again to try other dishes!

KUBDUBoqoFbVoecjELedKA.text: Hotcakes (pancakes) : excellent Omelette one of a kind Service excellent and staff friendly and bubbly

DbOiZRkRIOHuUAO0KoeCwA.text: The famous ricotta pancake! The crepe was cooked to the perfect fluffiness with chunks of ricotta instead, syrup and butter created a great balance. The banana was quite standard. A great sharing plate if you want to try other things at the restaurant. There is always a line up to get in, but it seems to move quickly. The Americano was too strong for me. Overall, fab brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. The famous ricotta pancake! The crepe was cooked to the perfect fluffiness with chunks of ricotta.

UryOhI04o9tvmmSipiUgQA.text: This place can get busy but it's totally worth it. Food is amazing. Everything looks spectacular. The staff is so friendly. Love!

l0Fbl5wu4W6Jb7NQ4bsLZQ.text: Went there recently twice. The horrible service was improved and all waiting staffs were so friendly...I tried all the staple... and kimchee fried rice with chorizo and soft shell crab. It was excellent. It is very new n Asian in a away but had enough tasty elements. It was fusion done well.Pancake is always so tasty... and scrambled egg... hard to fault itIt is very popular now with queue always so allow enough time and go when not raining as there is not much cover Rong outside of the restaurant

PErfG6UXupROru_r1I7hTQ.text: I  am giving 2 stars because service was amazing. The Food is pretty average food. If you want a place with decent food and great atmosphere you can definitely go there. Just don't expect much from food.

SJ-w9iOKF2sNA8dx2cBsmQ.text: The food is so good here for brunch! The portions are perfect and filling and the flavors are great! We tried the ricotta pancakes and the corn fritters. The coffee is very dark and amazing and the smoothies are excellent as well. The space is very cramped but that's something I can't seem to get used to in London (I'm from the states). A cute and quaint place to hangout at. I saw a lot of businessmen hanging out here with their laptops.

9QIlLUcZWaUA1var14mw9A.text: We went there for breakfast. Ordered the jasmine tea smoked salmon , red fruit bowl  and the fresh aussie. The fresh aussie is absolutely recommended, the salmon was fresh but the food is overpriced.

KfCUxn1wBpvy6vOCysqgqA.text: Granger & Co might just be my most favorite place in London - ever! No reservations possible, you just have to walk by and wait for a table. On week days that might take 10-20 minutes, on the weekend you will have to wait 30 minutes at least.The service is great, very friendly and welcoming! Once you're seated, you're in heaven! The menu contains about ten dishes. A quite perfect selection for any breakfast lover! My breakfast of choice on that day was a "Full Aussie": Salmon, Spinach, Eggs and Tomatoes. The food is fresh and outstanding! The coffee is also great! If possible, I would definitely come back every choice I get! Such a beautiful place!

4SQ4zeB42QgLfXN6lJbnKQ.text: Granger&co is easily one of my favourite places in the Kensington area. Great ambience and a simple yet delicious menu, what more can you ask for? I had the poached eggs on rye sourdough with a side of avocado and was really pleased with my order. Definitely coming back whenever I'm around in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Perfectly runny (yes, I'm a messy eater)
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Poached eggs on rye with a side of avocado and spinach
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Great breakfast!

PG5sSMiQ3NQX0XTDqsZ4EA.text: Fashionable crowd. Seems all the stylish, well heeled Notting Hill moms stop by here with their Bugaboos. There is a wait for a table - even on a Monday morning so be prepared. I can't imagine what it's like on the weekends at brunch time. Husband had the corn fritters and I had the scramble and toast which I added avocados to. It totally hit the spot and the toast had a square of the best salted butter I've ever had in my life. (How am I gonna go back to the ho hum butter back home?) the carrot cake we had for dessert - amazing. I regretted not getting the ricotta pancakes. They looked perfectly fluffy and excellent but this gives me an excuse to come back again the next time I'm in London.

zANbhBxDfNfLk9dj_NpAHw.text: This is a fantastic brunch spot with a friendly staff and good location. Only downside is the long wait.  We had to wait 25 minutes for a table at 10 am on a Monday morning!  Standout dishes include the flvegan granola which is made with an out of this world vicinity cream. The doctorate pancakes were just ok but they also do a kids size which isn't on the menu. The back bacon and scrambled eggs were great and the coffee sublime. It was expensive at 90 pounds for a family of four (kids 10 and 6) but ultimately worth it.

PGKrqmy_KaA6eEY1Z2BEcA.text: I had the ricotta hot cakes with a side of mixed berries (substituted the banana for berries), and was very satisfied with my order. The ricotta hot cakes were very tasty--extra fluffy and light, yet filling. So yummy! Their  latte was good, despite it being a small serving, it was alright. I went to Granger to have my first meal of the day, and suppose, I needed more coffee. Had I been served a bigger cup, it would've been amazing!! My better-half ordered the scrambled eggs, which was accompanied by two slices of sour dough toast  with a side of bacon. That was another tasty dish. I'm not sure how they prepare their eggs, they look like they're whipped, sonic you want more txt ute in your eggs, this won't be for you. If you like the whipped, creamy, airy-like eggs, this may be to your liking. I love the ambience--very euro-posh and artisan/modern. I love the high ceilings and cozy feel. The staff was friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta hot cakes with mixed berries
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs, sour dough toast and side of bacon

1KMZk5sshgYBtiNBLCWpPQ.text: We walked to Granger and Co for our first meal after landing in London! It was packed on a Friday afternoon at 2pm. Our visit was significantly marred by the fact that we waited an hour before our group of 4 could get a table. I ordered a halloumi and toast appetizer for us to share which was delicious. I got the Tuna Poke that was delicious but portions were small. One in our group got their burger which was very tender. The ingredients were all really fresh and flavorful. The food was good, however they're so busy and bordering on being short staffed at peak hours. The overall experience did not live up to the hype.

1HaWnMaKAVngEXF8Q5U6zg.text: I've had one of the best brunches at Granger & Co.  The Crisp Pork Sandwich itself was delicious, but oh my the side salad of cilantro and mint went together with the sandwich so well together that it was just amazing.  I don't think I've seen cilantro/mint duo used this way before.  The place is pricey (just like a lot of other things in London area, especially in Chelsea), and it gets crowded rather quickly even on weekdays.  We got there little after 10 am and we still had to wait a little.

IjtO8ujd2MaoFkiHecgM5Q.text: Great place for brunch. Ricotta hotcakes is super tasty. It's also nice for a light dinner.

O6Fu6XTOwf3yba98v9tFww.text: One of the few places that lived up to the hype.Get the hotcakes and scrambled eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Full Aussie breakfast
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. The best hotcakes

TPJAGRqG5STXvFAZSzjz2Q.text: Bill Granger, thank you for opening this new hot spot. I was in London for only 3 days, and 3 different people told me that, I as a foody, MUST visite this place. And they were so right. First, I realy don't know what thet do to the eggs, but the scrambled eggs are exeptionally delish! Try any side to it (I addes avocado's and chilli), and you are in eggs heaven. What's also great about this place, is that, is that there is lot's of healthy stuff on the menu. So you can go nuts, and treat yourself, and not feel guilty.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Picture perfect scrambled eggs!

iN_PYjjao8mucV1UL5k6JA.text: Very posh place in Notting Hill. Were there for breakfast - cool atmosphere, friendly staff, great selection of breakfast options. Had the Aussie Breakfast - very fresh & tasty. Definitely a recommendation.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Aussie Breakfast

gqXBPYxy8Lhy6dJ379hwEg.text: Such an amazing place and it's not just the food. The service is well above London average and very good even with US standards. The food is superb, especially the Burrata with charred bread. Very good old fashioned although slightly too sweet. Good drinks selection and great atmosphere. No reservations make it a bit tricky but nevertheless as enjoyable night as it can get. It's a lively venue with good food and perfect place to hangout with dear friends.

9uvXAU3WlNEpD3PC6vk0mw.text: Amazing food! Breakfast, lunch and dinner is delicious! Vito is my favorite server and service is always top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta hotcakes, banana and honeycomb butter.

7rzPWYs0V2AM7OYLP6enmQ.text: I was in town on business and had dinner here by myself before heading to Heathrow to fly home. I'm a young woman, and it was my first time in London -- though I've done a lot of other traveling. I sat at the bar, and the Aussie bartender was super creepy. He asked me what brought me to town, then he asked me if I was single, then he asked me if I was straight. At the end of the meal he berated me for not leaving him a tip in addition to the one included in the bill. Sexist pr*ck. Shame, because the food was really good. TLDR, if you're a woman dining solo be prepared for some weirdness.

JonfNVgiP3DV_NFSRgEHgA.text: Everything on the menu looks delicious. When we approached the restaurant I knew it was going to be good because there was a long line. People will always wait a bit for good food I've found, and this place was worth the wait. Avocado toast was amazing as well as the ricotta pancakes. If you've got the time, definitely eat here.

Co036fp01X2fxhXg0GiAkA.text: Stopped by while on vacation and the ricotta pancakes were so tasty! Only gave it 4 stars as I added 'bacon' on the side which I did not enjoy. It was more like dry Canadian bacon, not the crispy American bacon I was picturing. Either way, pancakes were enough to keep me going back.

MhSrTbGxy28dt79IexOzKA.text: I give it a 3 because of the lack of value. Very expensive for what you get and I cant justify the price by the output or experience. Great example, scrambled eggs with toast is £8+. nothing else with it. Ricotta pancakes were phenomenal but xome with nothing. I added an audience breakfast bc I eat like a fat kid and that doubked the price for a total bill of £32+ plus juice Also more on the value proposition, orange juice is £3+ and it's a SMALL!the price can't justify it but I'd recommend going only once. There is no english breakfast equivalent.I was asked by diff members of the staff how my meal was. Superb service.JEANS: OK by far.ORDER: wait staff

Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Aussie breakfast which was 13ish

fTrx7y6CmDO-CofDM1PXig.text: Love this place. Can't go wrong with super fresh, quality ingredients. Get in early or be prepared to wait in line!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Fish curry
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Healthy smoothie

GCck5bw-3iwkIvSmsUhoVA.text: Who knew it was this difficult to find a good place open for breakfast in central London at 6am on a Sunday? The insanity starts with the 2 sisters spending an all nighter catching up on "The Good Wife". 4am trip to primrose hill to see the sunrise and view the Balloon Regatta. (They look like waterspots in the pictures this dreary morning)  Walk across to the zoo where only the zebras were outside.Nothing open at 6am in the area for breakfast. Came back to Hyde park. Lots of dogs and birds, even saw the early morning swimmers at the Lido, but nothing open even in Kensington at 7am for breakfast.Finally with an 8am opening time, a few more options popped up on the screen.Grangers has been on my wish list for awhile. We reached at 8:15 and despite its 60+ covers, there was still a queue outside.Since it was just 2 of us, we were seated very quickly as majority of the waiting clientele seemed to be large groups of 4 and more.We had to wait a bit for our order to arrive, but we didn't mind. We avoided the highly recommended coffee so as to be able to sleep on arriving home. But the home made almond milk was great. (Don't tell anyone, but I added a bit of sugar to my milk)The coconut bread was oh so good, almost like a dense tea cake. Toasted with a bit of salted butter & o was in heaven. Yummy bacon & chipolatas & jasmine tea smoked salmon. The mushrooms were brilliant. The harissa we ordered for flavouring, really want needed as every dish had lovely flavours of its own.Packed up some more coconut bread to bring home for tea when we woke up. Definitely have to go back for the ricotta hot cakes & the coffee & try their lunch/dinner menus too.Loved the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Pulled belly pork wraps #livelifelikeldn
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Miso salmon #livelifelikeldn
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Prawn fettuccini #livelifelikeldn

3iNZNQxCJYiPHFNFvyHtxg.text: So great! We waited in line (arrived at 11am) for about half an hour, but the line went really fast. We ordered the scrambled eggs & sourdough (honestly, to die for!) and I got the specialty daily donut and my husband the specialty daily muffin. Everything we ordered was delicious. Service was quick, helpful, and friendly. The atmosphere is a little plain but is modern and clean. Definitely will be back!

8MKnFKSZswHpnbk_xdhKBQ.text: Visiting from New York City and looking for decent (not touristy) restaurant.  Found this restaurant on Yelp and was very pleased.  The food was very good and we highly recommend it if you are visiting Notting Hill area of London.  We had hot cakes (yum), burger, some curry dish and another dish that had poached eggs and avocado that was also yum.   Wait was a bit long ... it was a Saturday afternoon around 3:00pm.  They serve lunch menu till 5:00pm!!!  In NY, lunch menu ends at 3:00p, so we were pleased!  Cheers!

_5aMdYgHQ81CPJnlqYSLNA.text: Amazing food. Would have given 5 stars if service was a little quicker. But food is top notch. Everything we ordered was amazing.

eD0dt0U_BFEA54rOE47UHw.text: Food was good. Ingredients were high quality but staff neglected to tell me service charge was included and took £10 including service charge. Didnt know as someone had already paid the bill in cash.

GQXazm7zSoRLHndqBbuL8A.text: Feels like a hipster breakfast spot that could be in San Francisco or Brooklyn.The food was decent.  I think the owner and menu have Australian influences.There was a line out the door around 10:00 am on a Saturday morning.Go early if you can.

BJcZxR8_BcYMjInwGYhCzQ.text: When living in London this was my go-to place for a leasurely brunch where I just knew it was going to provide the goods.My absolute favourite which I ordered 9 times out of 10 was the ricotta hotcakes with banana and honeycomb butter...absolutely heavenly!Other notable mentions on the menu are the grass fed beef burger, prawn and chilli linguine and seriously all of their muffins and tray bakes are incredible.The freshly squeezed orange juice and homemade almond milk are top notch as is the allpress cold drip coffee.I absolutely miss the salted peanut brittle that I would buy and eat later that night. Please Bill open a Granger & Co in Melbourne!

MJ8WxtwQ48ZToxLJRNCHdw.text: Really good food and coffee, with a very nice staff. And finally some healthy options! Its bright walls and interior gave off this trendy hipster California vibe - so, if you're into that, you'll feel right at home.If going for brunch, go early - it's a popular place for locals and visitors alike, which means the weekend line can get long. The baristas know their coffee, though, which makes it well worth any wait.

_bCEAKGP8ottmALpL-TCQQ.text: Lovely spot for lunch, I had the curry which was great. The restaurant was extremely crowded so reservations are prolly wise.

pkC-OZgBA7PH2oyC6yT_kg.text: There is always a tremendous line out the door, but we managed to sneak in at the right time for dinner and didn't need to wait. Granger & Co is lovely on the inside, quite chic but in a cozy way. My friend and I shared the corgette chips, the kimchi dumplings, and the shrimp burger. The dumplings were absolutely phenomenal! The corgettes were quite nice, kind of a tempura fried so they were light and lovely. The shrimp burger was honestly bland. It came with a spicy sauce, but it didn't really help it at all. Would absolutely recommend Grange & Co, especially if you're willing to queue!

xC-mFkYaZ5-evIUe5I5brw.text: I have been here twice. Service can vary significantly depending on the server. However I never had any problem getting seat at the bar quickly. Now the food: it was ricotto hotcakes for me both the times and it did not disappoint. Amazing pancakes. There is a reason they are ranked #1 for breakfast in London. Latte was good too. Had to try this place while in London. They have another one near Kings cross and pancakes there are equally good.

6O3JWFw8Z2M7-W4xupEdoA.text: This place was so yummy. One of the best breakfast places in all the UK! The food was lovely, and coffee came out great. The staff were all nice, and service was quick. I ended up going three times because it was the best in the area! There were lines for waits, but I sat at the bar and still received great service.

8tHURczHxBf4zY9boAd27w.text: Staff are Friendly and welcoming.  We had the Scrambled Eggs and they were to dye for.  Maple syrup butter that comes with the famous ricotta pancakes was AMAZING, I could eat a tub of it.  However pancakes were a bit eggy for me

0eJRYqeRgWCUkw43L3Eaqw.text: Went to this neighborhood just to site see and walk Portobello. This restaurant stole the show. The atmosphere was amazing and the service and food were outstanding. A must visit for any meal of your day. The fried chicken sandwich and sambal chicken salad were very good. Can't wait to return!

Y2iOu2_tKD8CTLmhqwWoJg.text: Australian cruise and vibe! PandaPay run a trial here a few days ago, and as always, more than expected people turned up, as they brought their partners. Even though we only had our table book for 6, the staff where over the top friendly, bubbly and helpful. Nothing was too much of an issue. The menu is fresh, different and creative. I had the "miso aubergine, fried tofu & shiso" for starters. It was the perfect size, enough to bring on your hunger for more, though not too much that you're full for your main. The fried tofu was lightly fried and not oily at all. It was a glorious combination. Main course I had the "turmeric spiced chicken, slaw, peanuts,lime & coconut dressing" - very light, tangy & refreshing. The environment itself is buzzy, casual and lively. If you're up for a fun, social evening - check out Granger & Co

9hxMNeEszHqnF2RE4OUMwQ.text: Great healthy eat in London! It has been around for years now but has not lost its touch to its deep roots that keep it popular among locals and tourists alike. For breakfast the place is a mecca for families with babies (this morning everyone had at least one baby with; although we saw no high chairs).  For vegans/lactose intolerants: the coconut yogurt is NOT MADE OF COCONUT, but is a dairy yoghurt with coconut flavour!The food is good quality but rather on the expensive end of the scale. £3.5 for a slice of sourdough bread cut in two with almond butter is a high price to pay... The Fresh Aussie is a winner: delicious smoked salmon with kale and tomatoes and coriander! Yummy!!! Portions generally are "healthy" -- ie for your scales but you may get hungry in 2-3 hours ;) Service is good!

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Almond butter with 2 slices of bread -- technically printing money here
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Acai bowl - tasty, good stuff!!!

8nG7ytqwLF2LOnA7RVVnEA.text: Literally, it was one of the best brunches I have had. My friends and I went for a pretty late brunch after studying in a coffee shop. There was a bit of a line, but we were seated quite quickly. They have a lot of tables as well as high stool chairs surrounding the bar. The aesthetic of the place? Love. It's kind of a minimalist farm chic(?) style. There were a lot of flowers, white wooden floors, and large windows that made the entire restaurant bathed in sunlight. Basically, the atmosphere was perfect for an English brunch. Ok, let's talk food. We ordered the soft shell crab kimchi fried rice and the ricotta banana hotcakes. The kimchi fried rice was a punch of flavor with a poached egg, generous portions of kimchi, and chorizo slices. The dish also came with a lot of cucumbers and assorted veggies to cut through the flavor. (minor thing: the soft shell crab could be a tad more crispy in my opinion). But GUYS, the STAR of the show was definitely the hotcakes.  Absolutely divine. They are not like your typical British crepe-thin pancakes or the American shortstack, they kind of remind me of the pillowy Japanese style pancakes. They were so warm and fluffy. There was a sprinkle of powdered sugar on top, and fresh banana slices on the side. The pancakes came with this honey butter and syrup. We also ordered some of their homemade sodas: hibiscus and the ginger ale. The hibiscus was, by far, my favorite: not too sweet with a tang of lime juice. The ginger ale had freshly grated ginger in it. All in all, my favorite brunch place in one of my favorite neighborhoods in London and also near my go-to study cafe to boot. The atmosphere is perfectly lovely for a brunch Sunday. The place kind of reminds me of a spot you would go after having your summer book club meeting where you proceed to continue your discussion while sipping on some iced tea. The food is great, and the waitress was friendly. Highly recommend. Post. Script. Also the check came with this adorable postcard. The aesthetic is spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Kimchi fried rice and ricotta hotcakes.
Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Hibiscus and lime homemade soda.

LhQtj31H4S4s-aUa9JEsuw.text: Am going to divide my review into two categories: 1-Professionalism.It needs an experienced manager to manage the restaurant professionally. Professionalism starts with greetings until leaving the restaurant. In my opinion, the experience itself is a crucial part and also, of course, the quality of food. We are waiting in line to be seated. Then the manager wasn't pleasant to ask us to Make away for the tables outside the restaurant. I saw the same treatment happened with sheep on farms. Our turn comes up then she asked us where do you prefer to sit? We told her inside since it was cold.  The Waitresses came " without saying welcome to the restaurant" she just poured the water and gave us the menu and left.  I've found some black dots inside the glass, I thought it is in the glass itself but I've scratched it, and it was DIRTY. I've asked her politely to change the glass because it has dirt in it..... Then she starts holding the glass and starts placing her fingerprints and started to question me that there is no dirt, professionally she supposed to say " I apologize for that, let me change your glass." I told the manager that the waitress she was arguing when I told her to change the cup. Moreover, the manager didn't apologize for it.  After I paid, the didn't even say thanks for coming.2-Food.The food wasn't WOW that made me take Uber from Knightsbridge to Notting Hill for it. I've ordered the great scrambled egg. The plate it has one slice of toast cut in half and nub of butter between, scrambled egg, and a leaf of spinach.***A waste of Money, energy, and time.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. So so, :/

_Z6XThGsCgs4ZrD4YZcVoA.text: We went here for brunch and I was totally blown away. The main reason being the food that they make is sooooo far from what I could do. I have no freaking idea how they get their scrambled eggs to do that fluffy twirly thing. I mean, what the heck? And they also have rose harissa as a side, which was mind blowing. I put it on the toast and eggs and I was so happy. Seriously guys it's so good. The ricotta pancakes are all the rave and for good reason, because they're totally out of this world!!! no idea how they make those suckers either!!!!! They're fluffy and soft and creamy and delicious and massive! I feel like many brunch places offer food that wouldn't be terribly hard to make yourself at home, but Granger & Co is at a totally other level. You know it too because there's always a line. We went here at 8:30am on a Saturday and we got a seat but it was SO BUSY by the time we left. Service was great, the place is lovely looking, and the food is absolutely freaking magic delicious. Yes, it's magic delicious I'm not taking it back.

photos.caption: Photo of Granger & Co - London, United Kingdom. Ricotta hot cakes, banana and honeycomb butter

_C4BaRAYJfT0JzOUXi7kUg.text: Found this restaurant on yelp on our second day in London and decided to give it a try based on the review.We waited about 10 minutes before getting seated, which was not bad. However, the food was below my expectation. In my opinion, it was overrated. My friends ordered the hotcake, and avocado toast, which didn't give us the WoW moment at all. I ordered the chili fried egg roll which was basically a burger... I came from US and I had better brunch than this. IHOP's pancake is even better than the hotcake. I miss chicken and waffle now!!

9KnolUGhI2ei--EycbGukw.text: Had a dinner at Granger co. with friends. Food was wonderful with nice ambience. We enjoyed our food a lot. However, it's just a service need to be improved as service is bit slow. They don't book table, you have to walkinOne should definitely visit.

2SQ8PMrN83cL8omPTHyZjg.text: beautiful brunch for ladies and gentlemen, friends and family. when you walk in, waiters and waitresses are dressed and ready to greet you. it is an open floor plan that is brightly lit; lots of windows. to the right of the entrance is a barista bar, to the far back of the room, the ceiling-to-floor mirrors reflect light pouring in from beautiful, large windows. this is one of those spaces literary scholars would write about in a sparkly novel. the place is bustling. you should call to make reservations prior to your (and your party's) arrival. or, there are high stool chairs lined up beside the barista bar. i ordered the aussie breakfast, and it was delicious. the combination of eggs, tomato, avocado and parsley salad, slice of toast and salmon.. perfect way to start a chilly morning. delicious! there are friendly, healthy varieties. they bring out fresh displays of pastries and hot teas (teas, per request; pastries on display at the barista counter). every staff is well-mannered, efficient, and attentive. granger and co. is a beautiful place to bring a dear friend, host a ladies' brunch date, send family off, and the like. i would visit again if i ever get the chance!tip: bathroom stalls are beautiful, but they are found below ground floor. walk towards the far back, left corner and you should find a staircase leading you down.

1U1OfGGRy9bIVnz_46CdIw.text: My daughter and I had just flown in from the states and were working hard to stay awake.  Morning brunch sounded perfect.  What a wonderful surprise to find this restaurant within walking distance of our hotel.  The ricotta hot cakes were like nibbling on fluffy clouds of goodness and the avocado toast was clean and perfect.  We had the added pleasure of sitting at the bar next to a local who frequents that location.  She was lovely, lovely and friendly and really brightened our day.

432uxq-QPZuvEo3NUYXK_g.text: Ricotta Pancakes Ask for extra Butter~ forget the SyrupService once was great ~ 2 more times here and it was AWFUL!!!go during week!  Too crowded with lines on weekend.Weak coffee dont order.Had a delightful Dinner here as well.  Food is good -  cocktails amazing .  Do not get Bellini cocktail as they only fill half glass for £ 10 ~ and its prosseco!  However we sent drink back and at first manager argued 125ml, 125 ml, 125 ml... and im like its a half glass.  FINALLY he said: "would you like me to top it off with Prosseco?  I said "thank you"  ~  why does a customer have to struggle to get their point across when something is not right in a restaurant ~ fix it ! Immediately!  Do not make any customer feel less than!  Please. Worst SERVICE EVER.   They include tip.. so waitstaff could care less about serving you, checking if you need anything and grandly ignoring you..  the line on weekends is horribly long.  Be prepared to wait 1 hour standing in the cold. Food is good but not worth the flippant service and huge lines.. then they rush you out claiming they have people waiting!!! As well as the tables are jammed in so close people sit on top of you or run into you if you are seated anywhere but window lined seating.  In other words tables are in a zoo in a cage and you are the animal.

Bg8pAepFIeGPQAqpnlk6Dw.text: Very delicious! I got poached eggs and my hubby got scrambled eggs. Very good. Cute place.

L08EEQkPBvYhAr8DJLK3Og.text: What is Australian food? Hell if I know, but it doesn't involve shrimp or putting them on the barbie. While staying in Notting Hill, we came across this very hip restaurant. (FYI: I only use the word "hip" pejoratively). Aside from the crowd, the waiting for a table, the little foodie touches, the actual meal was awesome. I had the Parmesan-crumbed Chicken Schnitzel, Creamed Corn and Fennel Slaw. My wife had the Sticky Chili Belly Pork. We shared the best Bananas Foster of all time (as hip bistros do, this little slice of dessert heaven is no longer on the menu).

5t--TLQPPqhWVf2rGJjJPQ.text: Fabulous meal. Service was superb, our dishes were fantastic and the wine was complimentary. We arrived early Sunday evening and were able to enjoy a glass of wine outside while waiting for our table. We shared the flavorful miso tofu appetizer and for our main course we all three chose the yellow fish curry which was delectable. Would highly recommend.

0sR5ta_1RrK4YVMQEZQCag.text: Nice place welcoming staff delicious food I have to visit them once each visit to London

l2vjAS1dd9XG3ag1NEgrTQ.text: Stopped in this morning for breakfast after walking around portobello market. The ambiance is really cozy and gardenesque on the inside and there is bar and table seating. There was already a line when we arrived at 9:30, however because there was only two of us, we got seated at the bar very quickly. It looked like the remainder of the people in line with us also got seated pretty quickly as well, so don't be intimidated by the line! We ordered the ricotta hot cakes and the sunny fried eggs with a side of bacon. The hot cakes were really good, but I just wish the banana that came with had been cut and put on top. Not left whole underneath. The maple syrup was very good as well. The eggs were ok, the bread was very good and the bacon was a bit dry. All in all it was a very solid meal. My husband really enjoyed chatting with the barista, and even though they were very busy, she chatted with us throughout our meal. Oh, and the chai tea is really good! All in all would return and try other locations.

weENKWjAvNHaPSXLem51TA.text: The eggs are cooked to perfection! It looks like wiped cream .. I don't recommend the salmon thought!The ricotta (pancakes) hotcakes as they call them are delicious I wish I added spinach that would've gone great with the wipes eggs!!
